intro: Nonea anchusoides, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It is adapted to harsh, rocky environments and is often found in alpine regions. Nonea anchusoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in challenging climates.
